@graph.name: Easy Homemade Pad Thai - Tastes Better from Scratch
@graph.description: This amazing Pad Thai recipe is easy, approachable and can be made in under 30 minutes, fresh ingredients and a delicious homemade pad thai sauce.

@graph.name: Lauren Allen
@graph.description: Welcome! I’m Lauren, a mom of four and lover of good food. Here you’ll find easy recipes and weeknight meal ideas made with real ingredients, with step-by-step photos and videos.

@graph.name: Pad Thai
@graph.description: This amazing Pad Thai recipe is easy, approachable and can be made in under 30 minutes, fresh ingredients and a delicious homemade pad thai sauce.

video.name: Pad Thai
video.description: This amazing Pad Thai recipe is easy and approachable and can be made in under 30 minutes. It starts with fresh ingredients including rice noodles, chicken, shrimp, tofu, cilantro, bean sprouts, peanuts and scrambled eggs tossed in a delicious homemade pad thai sauce that is so good it tastes like it came from your favorite Thai restaurant.

recipeIngredient: 8 ounces uncooked shrimp, chicken, or extra-firm tofu (, cut into small pieces)
1 Tablespoon Sriracha hot sauce (, or more, to taste)

recipeInstructions.text: Cook noodles according to package instructions, just until tender.  Rinse under cold water.
recipeInstructions.name: Cook noodles according to package instructions, just until tender.  Rinse under cold water.

recipeInstructions.text: Mix the sauce ingredients together. Set aside.
recipeInstructions.name: Mix the sauce ingredients together. Set aside.

recipeInstructions.text: Heat 1½ tablespoons of oil in a large saucepan or wok over medium-high heat.
recipeInstructions.name: Heat 1½ tablespoons of oil in a large saucepan or wok over medium-high heat.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the shrimp, chicken or tofu, garlic and bell pepper. The shrimp will cook quickly, about 1-2 minutes on each side, or until pink. If using chicken, cook until just cooked through, about 3-4 minutes, flipping only once.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the shrimp, chicken or tofu, garlic and bell pepper. The shrimp will cook quickly, about 1-2 minutes on each side, or until pink. If using chicken, cook until just cooked through, about 3-4 minutes, flipping only once.

recipeInstructions.text: Push everything to the side of the pan. Add a little more oil and add the beaten eggs. Scramble the eggs, breaking them into small pieces with a spatula as they cook.
recipeInstructions.name: Push everything to the side of the pan. Add a little more oil and add the beaten eggs. Scramble the eggs, breaking them into small pieces with a spatula as they cook.

recipeInstructions.text: Add noodles, sauce, bean sprouts and peanuts to the pan (reserving some peanuts for topping at the end). Toss everything to combine.
recipeInstructions.name: Add noodles, sauce, bean sprouts and peanuts to the pan (reserving some peanuts for topping at the end). Toss everything to combine.

recipeInstructions.text: Top with green onions, extra peanuts, cilantro and lime wedges. Serve immediately!
recipeInstructions.name: Top with green onions, extra peanuts, cilantro and lime wedges. Serve immediately!
